thread.title: BINGO: Live fact-checks during Democratic debate
thread.title_full: BINGO: Live fact-checks during Democratic debate

author: WFTS Webteam
title: BINGO: Live fact-checks during Democratic debate
text:
12:19 PM, Oct 13, 2015 1 hour ago Next © 2015 Newsy.com. All Rights Reserved. Copyright 2015 Scripps Media, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Previous Next 
Tonight's Democratic debate probably won't be as widely viewed as the Republican debates — the field is smaller and there's less personality amongst the four declared Democrats running for president than there is in just the single Republican front-runner. 
But that means if you do watch the debate, our BINGO card will keep you entertained through the predictable questions and answers and hopefully we'll get a couple surprises for our time. 
Our BINGO card also has a live fact-check element - you'll be able to see some of the statements the candidates have made on these topics and how our partners at PolitiFact have rated their claims. 
POVERTY 
Bernie Sanders has said that we have the highest rate of childhood poverty of any major country on Earth. PolitiFact says MOSTLY FALSE. 
DRONES 
Lincoln Chafee has said that one of the reasons we're having trouble in Yemen is we lost the population on drone strikes. PolitiFact says HALF TRUE. 
ECONOMY 
Hillary Clinton has said that under Republicans, recessions happen four times as frequently as under Democrats. PolitiFact says MOSTLY TRUE. 
GLOBAL WARMING 
Martin O'Malley has said the effects of climate change contributed to the rise of ISIS. PolitiFact says MOSTLY TRUE. 
JOBS 
Bernie Sanders has said that the largest low-wage employer is not McDonald's or Walmart but the US government. PolitiFact says MOSTLY FALSE. 
TAXES 
Jim Webb has said that the U.S. didn't have a federal income tax until 1913. PolitiFact says MOSTLY TRUE. 
TRANS-PACIFIC PARTNERSHIP 
Martin O'Malley has said that he isn't allowed to read the Trans-Pacific Partnership before representatives vote on it. PolitiFact says MOSTLY FALSE. 
HIGHER EDUCATION 
Hillary Clinton has said that not one of the 17 GOP candidates have discussed how they'd address the rising cost of college. PolitiFact says FALSE. 
BLACK LIVES MATTER 
Bernie Sanders has said that African Americans are twice as likely to be arrested and almost four times as likely likely to experience the use of force during encounters with the police. PolitiFact says MOSTLY TRUE. 
BUSH/CLINTON LEGACY 
Martin O'Malley has said that the CEO of Goldman Sachs let his employees know that he'd be just fine with either Bush or Clinton. PolitiFact says MOSTLY FALSE. 
OBAMACARE 
Hillary Clinton has said a small majority of Americans don't think they like the Affordable Care Act but a large majority of Americans don't want to do away with the protections that are in it. PolitiFact says MOSTLY TRUE. 
GUN CONTROL 
Bernie Sanders voted against the Brady Bill which included background checks and waiting periods. PolitiFact says MOSTLY TRUE. 
PLANNED PARENTHOOD 
Martin O'Malley has said that 97 percent of the work Planned Parenthood does is about mammograms and preventative health. PolitiFact says HALF TRUE. 
BENGHAZI 
Hillary Clinton has said there have been seven investigations of Benghazi led mostly by Republicans that concluded nobody did anything wrong. PolitiFact says MOSTLY TRUE. 
WAGE GAP 
Bernie Sanders has said that 99 percent of all new income today is going to the top 1 percent. PolitiFact says MOSTLY TRUE. 
CLINTON EMAILS 
Hillary Clinton has said that if she hadn't asked for her emails to be made public, none of this would have been in the public arena. PolitiFact says MOSTLY FALSE. 
MILITARY 
Bernie Sanders has said that Saudi Arabia has the third-largest military budget in the world. PolitiFact says TRUE. 
IMMIGRATION 
Hillary Clinton has said that not a single Republican candidate is supporting a path to citizenship. PolitiFact says MOSTLY FALSE. 
Print out these cards and play with friends!
